Key Match Events: The Cincinnati Reds were shut out for the second consecutive game by the Chicago Cubs, losing 3-0.
Kyle Hendricks, who has struggled much of the year, dominated the Reds lineup, allowing just one hit through five innings.
Justin Wilson allowed an inherited runner to score and was charged with two additional runs after allowing all three batters he faced to reach base.
Isaac Paredes lined a single into center to push the first run of the day across the plate for the Cubs.
Pete Crow-Armstrong followed up with a line drive into center for an RBI single, pushing the Cubs lead to 2-0.
Chicago picked up another run on a 4-pitch walk, making the final score 3-0.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds are now tied for last place with the Pittsburgh Pirates at 76-85 on the year.
Rhett Lowder’s rookie season ended with a 1.17 ERA in six starts, without giving up a home run in his 30.2 innings.
The 85th loss of the year means that in eight of the last 10 full seasons, the Reds have reached at least 85 losses.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kyle Hendricks, a free agent after 11 seasons with the Cubs, received a standing ovation from the home crowd as he walked to the dugout.
The Reds' final game will be against the Cubs, while the Pirates face the Yankees.
